message.content: This question requires knowledge about the environmental impact of menstrual products. Using a menstrual cup instead of pads or tampons can help avoid waste. Menstrual cups are reusable and do not contribute to the amount of plastic waste that pads and tampons create. Option (A) is incorrect because menstrual cups have no effect on pill usage. Option (C) is incorrect because menstrual cups collect blood, they do not avoid it. Option (D) is unrelated to menstrual products as it refers to the flu, which is caused by a virus.

This question requires knowledge about the benefits of using a menstrual cup compared to pads or tampons. One of the main advantages of using a menstrual cup is that it helps to reduce waste. Pads and tampons are disposable and contribute to landfill waste when discarded. In contrast, a menstrual cup is reusable and can last for several years, significantly reducing the amount of waste generated. Option (A) is incorrect because menstrual cups are not related to pills. Option (C) is incorrect because menstrual cups do collect menstrual blood, but they do not avoid blood altogether. Option (D) is unrelated to the use of menstrual cups.

Option (D) is unrelated to the topic of menstrual cups.
